verse.roman:
tathāyaṁ cāvatāras te
bhuvo bhāra-jihīrṣayā
svānāṁ cānanya-bhāvānām
anudhyānāya cāsakṛt

synonyms: tathā—thus; ayam—this; ca—and; avatāraḥ—incarnation; te—Your; bhuvaḥ—of the material world; bhāra—burden; jihīrṣayā—for removing; svānām—of the friends; ca ananya-bhāvānām—and of the exclusive devotees; anudhyānāya—for remembering repeatedly; ca—and; asakṛt—fully satisfied.
translation: Thus You descend as an incarnation to remove the burden of the world and to benefit Your friends, especially those who are Your exclusive devotees and are rapt in meditation upon You.

purport.text: It appears that the Lord is partial to His devotees. Everyone is related with the Lord. He is equal to everyoneand yet He is more inclined to His own men and devotees. The Lord is everyone's father. No one can be His fatherand yet no one can be His son. His devotees are His kinsmenand His devotees are His relations. This is His transcendental pastime. It has nothing to do with mundane ideas of relationsfatherhood or anything like that. As mentioned abovethe Lord is above the modes of material natureand thus there is nothing mundane about His kinsmen and relations in devotional service.
